original: zad pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa bzhis ni byang la mi skye ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis chub pa rdzogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa bzhis ni byang la mi skye ba'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis chub pa rdzogs par byas pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the four intuitions which are the characteristics of the intuition of cessation, such as the mirror-intuition, etc., there is enlightenment; and by the intuition of the ultimate realm which is the characteristic of the intuition of non-production, there is perfection.

original: yang na chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par bslab par rtog pa ni byang chub ste thams cad mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par bslab par rtog pa ni byang chub ste thams cad mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: de nyid chen po ste 'og ma gnyis dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phye ba'i phyir ro //

original: de la sems bskyed pa ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis sems gnyis su med par mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis sems gnyis su med par mngon du byas pa'o //

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni don gyi mgo 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni don gyi mgo 'dren pa'o //

analyzed: dus ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo ste skad cig la 'jig cing mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji snyed ces bya ba ni mtha' yas pa'i dus la snyegs pa'i sgra'o//

analyzed: / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de dag la theg pa chen po'i don bstan nas te /

analyzed: de dag la mi dmigs pa'i snying rje chen po bstan pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /

translated: From that, the aspect of engaging in all worldly conventions through the medium of words and letters is called the conventional aspect.

original: de smon pa byang chub kyi ngo bo bskyed nas zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: de smon pa byang chub kyi ngo bo bskyed nas zhes bya ba la //
translated: Having generated the essence of the aspiration mind, one should train in the bodhisattva deeds.

original: smon pa des bskyed @122a * //
analyzed: smon pa des bskyed @122a * //

analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o zhes pa dang 'brel to //

original: de ji ltar bskyed par bya zhe na /

original: de ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i stobs kyis te /

analyzed: de la bsgom pa chos nyid la mnyam par gzhag pa'i yon tan sems la chags par byed pa'o //

original: ngo bo nyid ni rtsa ba'i rang bzhin no //

original: bshad pa ni 'grel pa'o//
analyzed: bshad pa ni 'grel pa'o//

original: de la re zhig rtog pa mngon du byed pa'i sems dad pa bskyed pa dang / rang gi bya ba 'di la bar chad zhi bar gyur nas mthar phyin par bya ba dang / rang gi ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i yon tan brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de la re zhig rtog pa mngon du byed pa'i sems dad pa bskyed pa dang / rang gi bya ba 'di la bar chad zhi bar gyur nas mthar phyin par bya ba dang / rang gi ston pa bcom ldan 'das kyi che ba'i yon tan brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Therein, first, wishing to generate faith in the mind of the reader, to pacify obstacles to the completion of one's own task, and to proclaim the great qualities of one's teacher, the Blessed One,

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis phyag 'tshal ba gsungs pa ni byang chub sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis phyag 'tshal ba gsungs pa ni byang chub sems kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

original: de la byang chub sems ni stong pa chen po rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems ni stong pa chen po rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes te /

original: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par lhag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par lhag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid ces pa ste /

original: de'i rnam par smin pa dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rten mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo ni byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid gzugs zhes te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rten mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo ni byang chub sems kyi bdag nyid gzugs zhes te /

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sku phyag rgya chen po'o //

original: de ni ye shes kyi tshogs rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ye shes kyi tshogs rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //

original: yang dpal ldan de lha'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dpal ldan de lha'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternatively, it is glorious because it is endowed with the perfection of the divine family.

original: yang na rdo rje sems dpa'i sku phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas na dpal ldan no //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje sems dpa'i sku phyag rgya chen po dang ldan pas na dpal ldan no //
translated: Alternatively, it is glorious because it is endowed with the great seal of the body of Vajrasattva.

original: de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams kyi tshogs gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas bstod pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje ni ye shes lnga dang rigs lnga'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi bdag nyid do //

original: des phyin ci log gi nyon mongs pa bcom pas na mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: des phyin ci log gi nyon mongs pa bcom pas na mtshon cha'o //

original: de ye shes kyi rtags su phyag na ldan pas can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ye shes kyi rtags su phyag na ldan pas can zhes bya'o //

original: de ni phyag mtshan gyi sgo nas bstong pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyag mtshan gyi sgo nas bstong pa'o //

original: btud pa ni lus la sogs pas phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: btud pa ni lus la sogs pas phyag 'tshal ba'o //

original: de la rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i skyo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i skyo nas bstod pa'o //

analyzed: yan lag lngas sa la rig par thal mo sbyar ba dang / sems la mdun du byas @123a * //

analyzed: pa'i tshul gyis so //

original: da ni dbu zhabs kyi don du gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dbu zhabs kyi don du gsungs te /

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa srid pa 'joms zhes te byang chub sems bsgom pa ni bshad zin to //

original: de ci 'dra zhe na srid pa 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: de ci 'dra zhe na srid pa 'joms pa ste /

translated: Existence is the nature of the five appropriative aggregates, and it is the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm, and the existence of the formless realm, because they arise and transform.

analyzed: de rang bzhin gyi sgyu ma dang 'dra bar shes pa'i srid pa 'joms pa ste chos thams cad phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //

translated: The Buddhas of this kind are said to ‚Äúdesire the Thought of Enlightenment.‚Äù

translated: What is the definition of that? It is the absence of intrinsic reality, which is the definition of emptiness, and is synonymous with the general definition.

translated: ‚ÄúDesire‚Äù means to desire by analyzing the view of the definition of the middle way in the ultimate sense.

original: byang chub sems de ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems de ji ltar bsgom zhe na /

original: snying rjes brlan pa'i zhes pa nas te /
analyzed: snying rjes brlan pa'i zhes pa nas te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúwith a mind moistened by compassion,‚Äù and so on.

original: snying rje ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu dang bral bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //

translated: Compassion is the antidote to violence. Its nature is non-hatred. Its characteristic is the desire to remove suffering and its causes.

original: de yang don gyi rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: de yang don gyi rnam pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i snying rje chen po ste /
translated: It is great compassion that has eight objects.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin dang ; rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / sa dang / rigs dang / rnyed pa dang / skyabs med pa la skyabs sbyin pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin dang ; rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / sa dang / rigs dang / rnyed pa dang / skyabs med pa la skyabs sbyin pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is great compassion that has nature, aspect, object, stage, type, acquisition, giving refuge to the helpless, and equality with the unequaled.

original: de la rang bzhin ni dus gsum med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni dus gsum med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Its nature is the nature of the three times.

original: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gsum pa snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gsum pa snying rje ba'o //
translated: Its aspect is the compassion for the three kinds of suffering.

original: dmigs pa ni gcig nas khams gsum gyi sems can la snying rje ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gcig nas khams gsum gyi sems can la snying rje ba'o //
translated: Its object is the compassion for sentient beings of the three realms, beginning with one.

original: sa ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its stage is the compassion in the stage of the first concentration, the special first concentration, and the four concentrations.

original: rigs ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba dang so so'i skye bo la snying rje pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba dang so so'i skye bo la snying rje pa'o //
translated: The lineage is that of the Sravaka, Pratyekabuddha, and ordinary man.

original: rnyed pa ni 'dod pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba las thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni 'dod pa dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba las thob pa'o //
translated: The acquisition is from the separation of the defilements of the realm of desire and the summit of existence.

original: skyabs sbyin pa ni 'khor ba chen pos 'jigs pa la'o //
analyzed: skyabs sbyin pa ni 'khor ba chen pos 'jigs pa la'o //
translated: The bestowal of refuge is for those who fear the great samsara.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ni grangs med pa'i sems can thams cad la snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ni grangs med pa'i sems can thams cad la snying rje ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The equality of the unequal is the compassion for all beings without number.

original: des 'jam phar gyur pa ni snying rjes brlan pa ste /
analyzed: des 'jam phar gyur pa ni snying rjes brlan pa ste /
translated: The mind moistened with compassion is the compassion that is moistened with compassion.

original: khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is moistened with compassion because it is free from anger.

original: snying rjes brlan pa yang de nyid sems kyang de nyid pas snying rjes brlan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: snying rjes brlan pa yang de nyid sems kyang de nyid pas snying rjes brlan pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind moistened with compassion is the mind moistened with compassion.

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba dang de'i rgyu dang bral bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi bag chags so //
translated: The impression of wisdom is the cause of the separation of the suffering of beings and the cause of that suffering.

original: kyis zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: kyis zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: By means of is the cultivation.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges pa'i don bstan pa'o //
translated: The word ni indicates the teaching of the meaning of certainty.

original: nan tan ni phyin ci ma log par bsgom pa la brtan pa'o //
analyzed: nan tan ni phyin ci ma log par bsgom pa la brtan pa'o //
translated: Intention is the firmness in the meditation without error.

original: bsgom par bya zhes pa ni byang chub sems la mnyam par gzhag pa'i yon tan sems la goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes pa ni byang chub sems la mnyam par gzhag pa'i yon tan sems la goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The meditation is the cultivation of the mind in the virtues of the concentration on the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyis bsgoms @124a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyis bsgoms @124a * //
translated: That Thought of Enlightenment is the meditation of the Buddhas of the three times.

original: zhes so ; / bstan pa ni sangs rgyas snying rje'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so ; / bstan pa ni sangs rgyas snying rje'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching is the verse beginning The Buddha, Compassionate One, etc.

original: nga ni sngar dngos po thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba de 'grel pa ni mu stegs rnams kyi zhes bya ba nas te /
analyzed: nga ni sngar dngos po thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba de 'grel pa ni mu stegs rnams kyi zhes bya ba nas te /
translated: The commentary on the words I am free from all things is from the extremists up to the non-Buddhists.

original: mu stegs pa ni bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa ni bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The extremists are the Vaisesikas, etc.

original: de dag gis med pa'i phyin ci log par sgro 'dogs pa ni btags pa ste bdag yod do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de dag gis med pa'i phyin ci log par sgro 'dogs pa ni btags pa ste bdag yod do zhes smra'o //
translated: Their superimposition of the non-existent, the reification, is the self.

original: gang gi sgra ni spyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi sgra ni spyir bstan pa ste /
translated: The word that is a general indication.

original: bdag dang gang zag la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang gang zag la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means any one of the self, person, etc.

original: de dang gang dang 'brel pa de'o //
analyzed: de dang gang dang 'brel pa de'o //
translated: That which is related to that is that.

original: rigs pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni mngon sum la sogs pa'o //
translated: Reasoning is direct perception and so on.

original: de yang mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba ste dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba ste dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Direct perception is free from conceptual thought and non-erroneous, such as the senses and so on.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum la sogs pas dpyad pa ste rang gi don la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum la sogs pas dpyad pa ste rang gi don la sogs pa'o //
translated: Inference is the analysis of the three modes and so on, such as one's own purpose and so on.

original: brtag pa ni dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ni dpyad pa'o //
translated: Examination is analysis.

original: rig pas dpyad na 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig pas dpyad na 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: When analyzed by reasoning, it becomes this:

original: phung po kun gyi nang na ni //
analyzed: phung po kun gyi nang na ni //
translated: In the midst of all the aggregates,

original: bdag po 'ga' yang mi rnyed do //
analyzed: bdag po 'ga' yang mi rnyed do //

original: gzhan slu bas na sgyu ma ste //
analyzed: gzhan slu bas na sgyu ma ste //

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang shes pa dang shes bya med pa la shes pa bzhin snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang shes pa dang shes bya med pa la shes pa bzhin snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, consciousness is like a cognition that appears as cognition, although there is no object of cognition.

original: de ltar phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa ni bslab par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de ltar phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa ni bslab par bya ba'i chos so //

original: thams cad du zhes pa ni rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes pa ni rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu pa rnams la'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas are on the ten stages.

original: la zhes bya ba ni yul lo //
analyzed: la zhes bya ba ni yul lo //
translated: On means in the domain.

original: bstan pa ni rjes su slob pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni rjes su slob pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga'i rang bzhin med par bstan to zhes @126a * //
translated: Thus, the aggregates are taught to be essenceless.

original: bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what it means.

original: dbu ba la sogs pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbu ba la sogs pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bubbles, etc.?

original: 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sa la sogs pa ni gzugs che phra yod do cog gi 'byung gnas dang gzugs kun la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sa la sogs pa ni gzugs che phra yod do cog gi 'byung gnas dang gzugs kun la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great elements, etc. are said to be the sources of all gross and subtle forms, such as earth, and they pervade all forms by their general characteristics.

analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' ni 'byung ba ma yin te kun du khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, space is not an element, because it is all-pervading.

original: de rnams las byung ba'i chos ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: de rnams las byung ba'i chos ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i dngos gzhi'o //

original: de ni / gzugs kyi phung por rab tu gsal //
analyzed: de ni / gzugs kyi phung por rab tu gsal //

original: zhes bya ste gsal ba ni mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ste gsal ba ni mngon du gyur pa'o //

original: gzugs med nyid du gzhan rnams ni //
analyzed: gzugs med nyid du gzhan rnams ni //

original: zhes pa ni ming bzhi'i phung po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ming bzhi'i phung po'o //

original: gzugs las gzhan gzugs med pa ste thogs pa med cing gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan gzugs med pa ste thogs pa med cing gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are formless because they are not form, because they are not impeded and are not grasped.üîΩThus, one of the five aggregates is clearly form, and four are clearly not form.

original: de ltar phung po lnga'i nang na gcig ni gzugs dang bzhi ni gzugs ma yin pa som nyi med par gsal bar ni the tshom med pa ste phung po bzhi ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga'i nang na gcig ni gzugs dang bzhi ni gzugs ma yin pa som nyi med par gsal bar ni the tshom med pa ste phung po bzhi ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no doubt about this, because the four aggregates are mind and mental factors.

original: gzugs dang gzugs ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las khams la sogs pa yang gzhan ma yin pa ni khams zhes brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid las khams la sogs pa yang gzhan ma yin pa ni khams zhes brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: 'o na dbu ba dang 'dra ba'i gzugs ni rdzas su 'dod pa ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbu ba dang 'dra ba'i gzugs ni rdzas su 'dod pa ma yin te ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gzugs kyi mtha' rdul phra rab rdzas su 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtha' rdul phra rab rdzas su 'dod do zhe na /

original: gzugs dang gzugs med kyi rdul phran //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med kyi rdul phran //

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: gzugs kyi mtha' ma'i cha ni rdul phran te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtha' ma'i cha ni rdul phran te /

original: thogs pa med cing mdun rgyab kyi cha med pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med cing mdun rgyab kyi cha med pa'o //

original: de yang gnyis te bsags pa'i rdul phra rab dang rdzas kyi rdul phra rab po //
analyzed: de yang gnyis te bsags pa'i rdul phra rab dang rdzas kyi rdul phra rab po //
translated: It is twofold: the aggregated subtle particle and the substantial subtle particle.

original: dang po ni brgyad dang dgu dang bcu bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po ni brgyad dang dgu dang bcu bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the accumulation of eight, nine, or ten.

original: de la brgyad bsags pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams te brgyad phan tshun bsags nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brgyad bsags pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams te brgyad phan tshun bsags nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: dgu bsags ba ni sgra ste gong ma rnams dang sgra nyid bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgu bsags ba ni sgra ste gong ma rnams dang sgra nyid bsags pa'i phyir ro //

original: bcu bsags pa ni lus la sogs pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: bcu bsags pa ni lus la sogs pa'i dbang po ste /

original: gong ma dgu dang lus la sogs pa nyid bsags nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma dgu dang lus la sogs pa nyid bsags nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from the combination of the former nine and the body and so on.

original: rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni gcig bur snang ba'o //üîΩrdzas kyi rdul phra rab des mig @126b la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bskyed mi nus pas /üîΩgzugs kyi rdul phran dbang shes min //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rdul phra rab ni gcig bur snang ba'o // rdzas kyi rdul phra rab des mig @126b la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bskyed mi nus pas / gzugs kyi rdul phran dbang shes min //
translated: The substance of a subtle particle appears as one.üîΩThat substance of a subtle particle is not able to generate the eye consciousness and so on,üîΩbecause a subtle particle of form is not a sense consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab de dbang pos mi sod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dbang pos mi sod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That subtle particle is not apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: de la dbang po ni bag byed pa dang rten mdzes par byed pa dang / rang rang gi spyod yul la dbang byed pa dang / rang rang gi rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba rnams la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dbang po ni bag byed pa dang rten mdzes par byed pa dang / rang rang gi spyod yul la dbang byed pa dang / rang rang gi rnam par shes pa bskyed par bya ba rnams la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculty is the basis for the beautiful, the basis for the sense object, and the basis for the sense consciousness.

original: de'i shes pa ni tshogs drug gi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni tshogs drug gi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness is the six consciousnesses.

original: min zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù means not produced.

original: de'i gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs gsungs pa ni /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: bskyed pas 'das pa ma yin la //
analyzed: bskyed pas 'das pa ma yin la //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dbang po lnga las 'das pa'i spyod yul gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i don mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste dbang po lnga las 'das pa'i spyod yul gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i don mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are not able to produce the object of the sense faculty that is past.

original: 'o na / gang gis bskyed ce na //
analyzed: 'o na / gang gis bskyed ce na //

original: de dag 'dus pa las skye ste rdul phra rab de dag brgyad la sogs pa 'dus pa bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyis mig la sogs pa'i rnam shes skyed par byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa las skye ste rdul phra rab de dag brgyad la sogs pa 'dus pa bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyis mig la sogs pa'i rnam shes skyed par byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They arise from the aggregation of those. The object-field of the aggregation of atoms, such as a pot, a cloth, etc., produces the consciousness of the eye, etc., not anything else.

original: 'dus pa de yang 'dod pa min //
analyzed: 'dus pa de yang 'dod pa min //
translated: That aggregation is not accepted as a real entity.

original: bum snam la sogs pa lta bu rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i spyod yul ni don dam pa'i rdzas su mi 'dod pa ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bum snam la sogs pa lta bu rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i spyod yul ni don dam pa'i rdzas su mi 'dod pa ste ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The object-field of the aggregation of atoms, such as a pot, a cloth, etc., is not accepted as a real entity in the ultimate sense. Why?

original: 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the characteristic of destruction.

original: de bas na rdul phra rab kyis ni rnam par shes pa mi bskyed la 'dus pas ni bskyed na yang rdzas don dam pa ma yin pas phyi rol gyi rdzas la spyod yul ni med do //
analyzed: de bas na rdul phra rab kyis ni rnam par shes pa mi bskyed la 'dus pas ni bskyed na yang rdzas don dam pa ma yin pas phyi rol gyi rdzas la spyod yul ni med do //
translated: Therefore, the atom does not produce consciousness, and even if the aggregation does produce it, it is not a real entity in the ultimate sense. Thus, there is no external object as the object-field.

original: phyi rol pa'i rdzas su yod pa'i rdul phra rab kying bkag par gsungs pa ni phyogs kyi cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de la phyogs kyi cha ni phyogs kyi cha bzhi dang steng 'og ste drug go //

translated: ‚ÄúParts‚Äù refers to the six directions, the four cardinal directions, above, and below.

original: de ltar tha dad pa ni rab phye bas she'o //
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa ni rab phye bas she'o //

original: de bas na lto rgyab kyi cha med par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab la yang dbye bar mngon zhes te /
analyzed: de bas na lto rgyab kyi cha med par 'dod pa'i rdul phra rab la yang dbye bar mngon zhes te /

original: rdzas su gnas pa'i chos la phyogs bzhi dang steng 'og khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: rdzas su gnas pa'i chos la phyogs bzhi dang steng 'og khas blangs dgos so //

analyzed: mngon zhes pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i gong ma'i don yin par gsal zhes pa'i don to // de'i phyir / zur dang zur can rtog pa gang //
translated: ‚ÄúSeen‚Äù means ‚Äúit is clear‚Äù that the meaning of ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is a pot, etc.üîΩTherefore,

original: de ni rdul phran ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rdul phran ga la 'gyur te /

original: de la zur ni phyogs cha drug go //
analyzed: de la zur ni phyogs cha drug go //
translated: ‚ÄúCorner‚Äù refers to the six directions.

original: zur can ni rdul phran te zur dang ldan pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: zur can ni rdul phran te zur dang ldan pa'i phyir ro//
translated: ‚ÄúThat which has a corner‚Äù refers to the particle, because it has a corner.

original: @127a * // de dag tu ni rtog pha gang //
analyzed: @127a * // de dag tu ni rtog pha gang //

original: de ni rdul phran gal 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni rdul phran gal 'gyur //

original: zhes te bsags pa ni yan lag dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes te bsags pa ni yan lag dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the accumulation has parts.

original: 'o na gnas kyi tshad ma dang / rigs kyi tshad ma dang / dus kyi tshad ma dang don byed pa'i tshad ma bzhi dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnas kyi tshad ma dang / rigs kyi tshad ma dang / dus kyi tshad ma dang don byed pa'i tshad ma bzhi dang 'gal lo zhe na /

analyzed: de la kun du rgyu ni mu stegs pa mi gtsang ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: With regard to that, the wandering mendicant is a tƒ´rthika who cultivates impurity.

analyzed: don de nyid ni de bzhin kun gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de la med pa ni kun gzhi med pa ste mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: don dang sbyar ba ni ;
analyzed: don dang sbyar ba ni ;

original: / de ltar kun gzhi rnam shes ni //
analyzed: / de ltar kun gzhi rnam shes ni //

translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù one might ask, ‚Äúhow can one speak of the existence of the self-awareness of the buddhas?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù one might ask, ‚Äúhow can one speak of the existence of the self-awareness of the buddhas?‚Äù

analyzed: de gsum phan tshun ltos nas 'byung bas na tshor bya med pas na tshor ba med /

original: don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dang po tshor ba pos tshor bar ma gyur na tshor byar mi rung ste /

analyzed: de bzhin du tsher bya dang las med na tshor ba po yang mi skye ste /

analyzed: so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes la tshor ba po dang tshor byed dus gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar rig pa med na sems ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rig pa med na sems ji ltar bya zhe na /

analyzed: sems 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / de la sems 'di dag ni ming tsam ste zhes pa ni /

analyzed: de lta bas na /

analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma la /

translated: ‚ÄúGenerated by connection‚Äù means generated from the connection of dependent origination.

original: 'di lta ste don dam par rang bzhin du spyi mthun gyi las rgyu 'bras kyis bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste don dam par rang bzhin du spyi mthun gyi las rgyu 'bras kyis bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that ultimately it is generated by the common karma of the cause and effect of nature.

original: de'i dpe ni myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dpe ni myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The example of that is ‚Äúa sprout‚Äù and so on.

original: sa bon la sogs pa dang pags pa la sogs pa rnam pa gang la yang med kyang 'brel pa tha dad du 'byung ba ltar phyi nang gi chos rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa dang pags pa la sogs pa rnam pa gang la yang med kyang 'brel pa tha dad du 'byung ba ltar phyi nang gi chos rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as the seed, etc., and the skin, etc., do not exist in any way, yet they arise as a different connection, so also are outer and inner phenomena.

original: de bas na don dam par na ci 'dra zhe na sgyu ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par na ci 'dra zhe na sgyu ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, what is it like in the ultimate? It is like an illusion, etc.

original: de la phyi ni 'dus byas pa'i chos gzugs kyi phung po ste /üîΩ'brel ba can gyi rten 'brel @135a * //
analyzed: de la phyi ni 'dus byas pa'i chos gzugs kyi phung po ste / 'brel ba can gyi rten 'brel @135a * //
translated: Among them, the outer is the conditioned phenomena of the form aggregate.

original: gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the characteristic of dependent origination, which is the connection.

original: de ltar med pa las byung ba rgyu 'bras kyi chos mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar med pa las byung ba rgyu 'bras kyi chos mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If it were like that, arising from nonexistence would not be possible as the phenomena of cause and effect.

original: chos rnams zhes pa nas te phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams kun rdzob tu rang gi sa bon nam rgyu las skyes pa 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams zhes pa nas te phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams kun rdzob tu rang gi sa bon nam rgyu las skyes pa 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: The phenomena of the aggregates, etc., are not contradictory in arising from their own seeds or causes conventionally.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu yang rgyu nyid stong pa ste gang chos rnams rgyur gyur pa de'i rgyu'i ngo bo ma grub pas rang bzhin med pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu yang rgyu nyid stong pa ste gang chos rnams rgyur gyur pa de'i rgyu'i ngo bo ma grub pas rang bzhin med pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause is also empty of being a cause. The cause of phenomena is not established as having the nature of a cause, so it is essenceless.

original: 'du byed kyi rgyu ma rig pa de tshe snga ma'i sred len gyi rgyu'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyu ma rig pa de tshe snga ma'i sred len gyi rgyu'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: For example, the cause of formations, ignorance, is the result of the cause of craving and grasping in a previous life.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rgyu 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid de ma rig pa'i 'bras bu yin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rgyu 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid de ma rig pa'i 'bras bu yin no ;
translated: Similarly, the characteristic of the cause of consciousness, formations, is the result of ignorance.

original: / de ltar gcig la rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bor snang bas na /
analyzed: / de ltar gcig la rgyu 'bras kyi ngo bor snang bas na /
translated: Thus, since the nature of cause and effect appears in one,

original: rten cing 'brel pa tsam du zad kyi rgyu nyid 'di nyid 'di yin zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa tsam du zad kyi rgyu nyid 'di nyid 'di yin zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: they are merely dependently originated. There is no essence that can be said to be this or that.

original: de ltar rgyu rang bzhin med pa las byung ba'i chos ni mi skye ba nyid shes par bya /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu rang bzhin med pa las byung ba'i chos ni mi skye ba nyid shes par bya /
translated: Thus, phenomena that arise from a cause that lacks essence should be known to be non-arisen.

original: rgyu yod na skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu yod na skye ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the cause exists, arising exists.

original: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos rnams ni stong pa nyid ces rab tu grags /
analyzed: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos rnams ni stong pa nyid ces rab tu grags /
translated: Thus, phenomena that are non-arisen are well known as emptiness.

original: de'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid med pas na skye ba med la mi skye ba'i chos ni stong pa nyid du grags te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid med pas na skye ba med la mi skye ba'i chos ni stong pa nyid du grags te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it does not exist as the nature of a cause, it is non-arisen. The non-arisen phenomenon is renowned as emptiness, as the Transcendent Victor has said.

original: mi skye ba'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: What is a non-arisen phenomenon?

original: mdor bsdus pa ni phung pa lnga khams la sogs pa der gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni phung pa lnga khams la sogs pa der gsungs pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is the five aggregates, the constituents, and so forth.

original: de ltar chos rnams mi skye ba yin na kun rdzob tu gang las 'byung zhe na ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams mi skye ba yin na kun rdzob tu gang las 'byung zhe na ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, if phenomena are non-arisen, from what do they arise conventionally?

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin med pa de 'gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin med pa de 'gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThatness‚Äù refers to the ultimate, which is the absence of nature, because it is unchanging.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun rdzob yin pas zhes pa ste bden pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob yin pas zhes pa ste bden pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the conventional, since the two truths are not different.

original: don de nyid kun rdzob ces pas na /
analyzed: don de nyid kun rdzob ces pas na /
translated: The meaning of that is stated by ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma 'brel nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma 'brel nges pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not related to ascertainment.

original: gang dang gang du kun rdzob kyi chos yin pa de dang de ru don dam pa'i stong pa nyid yod de me dang du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gang dang gang du kun rdzob kyi chos yin pa de dang de ru don dam pa'i stong pa nyid yod de me dang du ba bzhin no //
translated: Wherever there is a conventional phenomenon, there is ultimate emptiness, just as there is smoke wherever there is fire.

original: de'i dpe ni byas pa mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i dpe ni byas pa mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: The example is like the impermanence of the produced.

original: byas pa ni 'dus byas pa bum pa lta bu mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa ste rkyen gyi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa ni 'dus byas pa bum pa lta bu mi rtag pa ni 'jig pa ste rkyen gyi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The produced is the conditioned, like a pot. Impermanence is destruction, because it is dependent on conditions.

original: des na 'dus byas yod pas 'jig pa bzhin du'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des na 'dus byas yod pas 'jig pa bzhin du'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, just as the conditioned exists, so does destruction.

original: de ltar de bzhin nyid dang kun rdzob gcig tu gyur nas thar par ji ltar 'gyur snyam @135b na ;
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin nyid dang kun rdzob gcig tu gyur nas thar par ji ltar 'gyur snyam @135b na ;
translated: Thus, if reality and convention become one, how can there be liberation?

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba la sogs pa ste kun rdzob gnyis nyon mongs pa yin te rtsa ba'i drug pos sems nyid nyon mongs par byed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba mi skye bar byed pa dang / skyes pa sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba la sogs pa ste kun rdzob gnyis nyon mongs pa yin te rtsa ba'i drug pos sems nyid nyon mongs par byed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba mi skye bar byed pa dang / skyes pa sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two conventions are afflictions, because the six basic ones afflict the mind itself, prevent the future arising of virtue, and obscure what has arisen.

original: de yang ma rig pa la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa la shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood as ignorance.

original: de bas kun rdzob nyon mongs pa las skyes /
analyzed: de bas kun rdzob nyon mongs pa las skyes /
translated: Therefore, the relative arises from the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa'i las sems pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs pa'i las sems pa skye ba'o //
translated: Due to the power of the afflictions, the mind that intends virtuous and other types of karma arises.

original: las las sems kyang skye //
analyzed: las las sems kyang skye //
translated: Karma also arises from the mind.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i las bag chags pa'i gnas sems 'byung ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las bag chags pa'i gnas sems 'byung ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: The mind that is the basis for the habitual tendencies of virtuous and other types of karma arises.

original: sems ni bag chags sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sems ni bag chags sdug bsngal te /
translated: The mind is the habitual tendency of suffering.

original: sems de yang dge ba la sogs pa ste bag chags 'du byed kyis gzir ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems de yang dge ba la sogs pa ste bag chags 'du byed kyis gzir ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That mind is also the habitual tendency of virtuous and other types of karma because it is afflicted by the formations.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bag chags de rang bzhin shes nas spangs pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bag chags de rang bzhin shes nas spangs pa ni /
translated: The habitual tendency of suffering is abandoned by knowing its nature.

original: bag chags bsal nas bde ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags bsal nas bde ba'o //
translated: Happiness is when the habitual tendencies are removed.

original: zhes te sems las su rung ba la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes te sems las su rung ba la shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the pliability of the mind.

original: bde ba'i sems ni zhi ba ste //
analyzed: bde ba'i sems ni zhi ba ste //
translated: The mind of happiness is peace.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ste sems rnam par dben par lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ste sems rnam par dben par lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free of afflictions because it views the mind as being isolated.

original: de'i phyir / zhi ba'i sems ni rmongs pa min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / zhi ba'i sems ni rmongs pa min //
translated: Therefore: The peaceful mind is not confused.

original: yang dag pa'i don ni rtogs pa la mi sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don ni rtogs pa la mi sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not obscured with regard to the realization of the perfect meaning.

original: ma rmongs pa yis de nyid rig / don dam pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ma rmongs pa yis de nyid rig / don dam pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimate reality has the nature of emptiness.

original: de nyid rig pas grub pa 'thob //
analyzed: de nyid rig pas grub pa 'thob //
translated: By knowing thatness, one attains accomplishment.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob ste sdug bsngal gsum las thar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob ste sdug bsngal gsum las thar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One attains nirvana, because one is liberated from the three kinds of suffering.

original: de bas na byang chub sems mchog de nyid ni stong pa nyid ces rab tu gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems mchog de nyid ni stong pa nyid ces rab tu gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, that very supreme mind of enlightenment is declared to be emptiness.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems kyi nang na rab tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa nyid ni byang chub sems kyi nang na rab tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic reality is declared to be within the mind of enlightenment.

original: stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'i byang chub sems de'i khyad par gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rang bzhin med pa'i byang chub sems de'i khyad par gsungs pa ni /
translated: The distinctive feature of that emptiness of intrinsic reality, the mind of enlightenment, is stated:

original: de bzhin de nyid de mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin de nyid de mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is thusness, because it does not change.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ste phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ste phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the limit of reality, because it is nonerroneous.

original: sdug bsngal ni phung po lnga ste ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni phung po lnga ste ;
translated: Suffering is the five aggregates,

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'khor ba'i phung po sdug bsngal yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phung po sdug bsngal yin //
translated: The aggregates of cyclic existence are suffering.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa'i byang chub sems ni sdug bsngal bdag med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa'i byang chub sems ni sdug bsngal bdag med do //
translated: The enlightenment mind of suffering and selflessness is the suffering and selflessness.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /üîΩmtshan ma med dang don dam @136a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni / mtshan ma med dang don dam @136a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚ÄùüîΩinclude the ultimate,

original: dang ; / chos kyi dbyings ni gzung ba yin //
analyzed: dang ; / chos kyi dbyings ni gzung ba yin //
translated: the signless, and the realm of phenomena.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo bstan nas don des bsdu ba ni gang dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo bstan nas don des bsdu ba ni gang dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, having taught the essence of the ultimate enlightenment mind, the summary by that meaning is ‚ÄúWhoever does not know emptiness‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag ces pa ni rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag ces pa ni rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Whoever‚Äù refers to any yogi.

original: stong nyid mi shes pa ni dbu ma'i byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin med pa ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid mi shes pa ni dbu ma'i byang chub kyi sems rang bzhin med pa ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not knowing emptiness‚Äù is not realizing the emptiness of the middle, the absence of intrinsic existence of enlightenment mind.

original: grol ba'i skal ba mi ldan pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grol ba'i skal ba mi ldan pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not having the fortune of liberation‚Äù is not actualizing perfect complete enlightenment.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: sred pa'i zhes bya ba nas te /
analyzed: sred pa'i zhes bya ba nas te /
translated: ‚Äú Craving‚Äù and so on.

original: gti mug can ni chos rnams rang bzhin med pa'i don yang dag par mi shes pa ste dngos po thams cad la zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug can ni chos rnams rang bzhin med pa'i don yang dag par mi shes pa ste dngos po thams cad la zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ignorant are those who do not understand the meaning of the absence of intrinsic nature of phenomena, because they cling to all things as having substantial reality.

original: 'gro drug ni 'jig rten pa'i lta ba'i tshul gyis gsungs te lha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro drug ni 'jig rten pa'i lta ba'i tshul gyis gsungs te lha la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six destinies are spoken of in terms of the views of the world, such as the gods and so forth.

original: don ni 'di yin te rang bzhin med pa'i don ma rtogs nas dngos po can du gyur ma thag yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gyur bas na srid par ltung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te rang bzhin med pa'i don ma rtogs nas dngos po can du gyur ma thag yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'gyur bas na srid par ltung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is this: without understanding the meaning of the absence of intrinsic nature, one immediately becomes a substantialist, and so, by the transformation of the conception of existence, one falls into cyclic existence.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub sems kyi 'grel pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub sems kyi 'grel pa bshad zin to //
translated: The commentary on the ultimate thought of awakening is finished.

original: da ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems cher gzhag pa ni stong nyid ces bya ba nas te /
analyzed: da ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob kyi byang chub kyi sems cher gzhag pa ni stong nyid ces bya ba nas te /
translated: Now, the correct relative thought of awakening is presented in the line ‚ÄúEmptiness is the supreme bliss,‚Äù and so forth.

original: de la stong nyid de'i rnal 'byor pas de ltar sgom par byed pas na /
analyzed: de la stong nyid de'i rnal 'byor pas de ltar sgom par byed pas na /
translated: There, the yogi of that emptiness meditates in that way.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i byang chub sems de ltar bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas snying rje dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i byang chub sems de ltar bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas snying rje dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The yogin who meditates on that bodhicitta, which is ultimately essenceless, should meditate with compassion.

original: de la snying rje dang stong pa nyid sbyor bas rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de la snying rje dang stong pa nyid sbyor bas rnal 'byor ro //
translated: There, the yoga is the union of compassion and emptiness.

original: de kho na nyid ni gzhan gyi don la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni gzhan gyi don la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Reality is for the sake of others, and so on.

original: mtho ris dang byang grol ni smon cing grol bar byed pas gzhan don no //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol ni smon cing grol bar byed pas gzhan don no //
translated: Heaven and liberation are for the sake of others, since they are wished for and liberated.

original: sems can gyi don la chags pa'i shes rab ni dga' pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la chags pa'i shes rab ni dga' pa'i blo'o //
translated: The mind of delight is the wisdom that is attached to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de la the tshom mi za bas the tshom yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de la the tshom mi za bas the tshom yang med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no doubt about that, there is also no doubt.

original: snying rje bsgom dgos pa'i gtan tshigs ni pha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje bsgom dgos pa'i gtan tshigs ni pha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reason for the necessity of cultivating compassion is father and so on.

original: de la sa bon dang lus rtas par byed pa'i phyir na pha dang ma'o //
analyzed: de la sa bon dang lus rtas par byed pa'i phyir na pha dang ma'o //
translated: There, father and mother are so called because they nourish the seed and the body.

original: pha dang ma'i rigs ni bshes gnyen no //
analyzed: pha dang ma'i rigs ni bshes gnyen no //
translated: Friends are the family of father and mother.

original: legs par byed pas phan byed pa'o //
analyzed: legs par byed pas phan byed pa'o //
translated: Benefactors are those who benefit through good deeds.

original: phan dus gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: phan dus gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When is the time to benefit?

original: sngon dus te thog ma med pa'i tshe rabs nas so //
analyzed: sngon dus te thog ma med pa'i tshe rabs nas so //
translated: In the past, i.e., from beginningless rebirths.

original: des na sems can la drin lan bya @136b bar 'os te /
analyzed: des na sems can la drin lan bya @136b bar 'os te /
translated: Therefore, it is proper to repay the kindness of sentient beings.

original: phan lan bya dgos so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phan lan bya dgos so zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that one should repay their kindness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gdug par byed pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste gdug par byed pas so //
translated: Because of the afflictions, etc.

original: gang du zhe na srid ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang du zhe na srid ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Where? In the realm of existence, etc.

original: de la ma rig pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal sbyin pa ltar rig pa'i dus su bde ba sbyin pa yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal sbyin pa ltar rig pa'i dus su bde ba sbyin pa yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: There, it is as if ignorance gives suffering, but when there is knowledge, it gives happiness. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir sems can la phan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can la phan par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one benefit sentient beings?

original: mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Heaven, etc.

original: lha dang mi ste dge ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi ste dge ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the result of virtue.

original: gang zhes pa ni sbyin pa la mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes pa ni sbyin pa la mtshon pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to giving.
